items.title: India Pesticides, Alkyl Amines shares drop up to 4% amid govt's anti-dumping measures
items.description: So far this year, shares of India Pesticides, Insecticides India, and Alkyl Amines have declined by as much as 20 percent

items.title: Zomato, Swiggy shares dive up to 39% in 2025, Macquarie 'cautious' on quick commerce but prefers dineout plays
items.description: Shares of Zomato and Swiggy were sharply lower amid buzz of quick commerce rival Zepto's $250 million secondary sale ahead of IPO, and a cautious note by Macquarie.

items.title: HCL Tech shares jump 3% after firm becomes Western Union's 'largest preferred partner'
items.description: HCL Tech and Western Union will set up a new India-based technology center in Hyderabad.

items.title: Bank Nifty rises for 9th straight day, crosses 52,000-mark as RBI changes PSL norms
items.description: To strengthen credit availability across key sectors, the revised PSL norms will introduce higher loan limits, expand eligibility criteria, and set increased lending targets for banks

items.title: Infosys shares rise nearly 3% despite Jefferies' 15% target price cut
items.description: Infosys share price: However, Jefferies believes the risk of a valuation downgrade is limited, citing strong free cash flow conversion and improved payouts.

items.title: Ace investor Madhu Kela's latest smallcap bet - SG Finserve shares hit 20% upper circuit
items.description: SG Finserve, a technology-driven NBFC registered with the RBI, specialises in business financing solutions

items.title: Apeejay Surrendra Park Hotels: Does the correction offer an opportunity to check into this hotel stock?
items.description: The hotelier is poised for pricing growth as it commands industry-leading occupancy levels while its balance sheet remains strong

items.title: Selloff in leading shares of drugmakers after Trump hints at tariffs on pharma imports
items.description: Currently, US charges nearly zero duties on pharmaceutical imports. India on the other hand imposes around 10 percent tax on pharma imports from US.

items.title: Garden Reach Shipbuilders' stock up 5% on deal with German firm for two multi-purpose vessels
items.description: Garden Reach share price: With this latest deal, GRSE's total order for these vessels remains valued at approximately $108 million, with no changes in financial terms.

items.title: Nifty pauses after a six-day rally to slip below 23,700, Sensex off day's high on profit booking
items.description: The broader market traded in the red, with the Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 slipping 0.89 and 1.19 percent, respectively.

items.title: What do leading monsoon indicators suggest for this season?
items.description: Most forecasts indicate a low likelihood of an El Niño phase in the next three to five months, which should be good for the rural economy

items.title: Agri Picks Report March 25, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation procured 864.7 tonnes of mustard as of Thursday, or 0.06% of the total 1.5 million tonnes it aims to buy during the 2024-25 (Jul-Jun) rabi season under the price support scheme.

items.title: Live: Nifty At 2-Month High; Will It Re-test 23,800?| Mark Matthews On Tariff Tantrums| Opening Bell
items.description: The benchmark Nifty 50 jumped more than 1 percent to hit nearly a seven-week high after a gap-up opening on March 24, continuing its northward journey for the sixth consecutive session as bulls remained in strong form with consistent buying interest from FIIs. The index made a good start to the week and is now just 150 points away from its previous swing high of 23,800, which is a crucial zone for further upward movement. If the index decisively surpasses this zone, it can negate the lower highs-lower lows formation and open doors for the 24,000 and 24,200 levels. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at another positive start asnd overnight Wall Street saw a strong rally. Among stocks to watch – RVNL, GRSE, Cement stocks and Suzlon will be in focus. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Ajit Mishra--SVP, Technical Research, Religare Broking and Mark Matthews-- Head of Research, Asia, Julius Baer

items.title: Britannia shares slip as strike in Gujarat plant disrupts operations
items.description: Britannia has stated that it is currently assessing the extent of the strike’s impact while leveraging its available resources to ensure minimal disruption to supply

items.title: Chart of the Day | How Trump’s tariffs are changing IT companies’ demand outlook
items.description: Tariffs are not expected to uniformly affect all business segments of IT companies

items.title: Sensex, Nifty eye seventh straight gain: Key levels to watch today
items.description: Global uncertainties, including geopolitical tensions and tariff-related disruptions, remain key risks. Going forward, the market’s trajectory will depend on a sustained recovery in domestic consumption and resilient corporate earnings.

items.title: UBS upgrades UltraTech Cement, Dalmia Bharat, Ambuja Cement to 'buy', shares jump up to 3%
items.description: UBS sees structural cost savings, price stabilization, and sector consolidation driving a strong rebound for cement players, such as ACC, Ambuja Cement and Dalmia Bharat in FY26.

items.title: RNVL shares gain on emerging lowest bidder for a contract of Rs 115 crore
items.description: Rail Vikas Nigam share price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 647.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 220.00 on 15 July, 2024 and 15 April, 2024, respectively. The share price rose more than 42 percent in last one-year.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex, Nifty erase gains, trade flat; UltraTech Cement, Trent, HDFC Bank top gainers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Among the sectors, except IT and bank all other sectoral indices are trading in the red. UltraTech Cement, Trent, Bajaj Finserv, HDFC Bank, HCL Technologies are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are IndusInd Bank, Dr Reddy's Labs, Hindalco Industries, Shriram Finance, Bajaj Auto. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices down 1 percent each.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) extended their buying on third day on March 24 as they purchased equities worth Rs 3,055.76 crore, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities of Rs 98.5 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade HCL Tech, Shree Cement, Asian Paints, Nykaa, Bharti Airtel, Samvardhana Motherson, and others on March 25?
items.description: The benchmark indices are likely to surpass their swing high of February in the upcoming sessions. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: HCL Tech, EaseMyTrip, SG Finserve, GNFC, SEAMEC, Garden Reach Shipbuilders, RVNL, Restaurant Brands Asia in focus on 25 March

items.title: Taking Stock: Market extends gains on 7th day; Nifty tops 23,800 but fails to hold early gains
items.description: Except IT, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with auto, capital goods, consumer durables, metal, oil & gas, power, PSU bank, realty, telecom down 1-1.5 percent.

items.title: Live: Market Pauses For Breath After 6-Day Surge; IT Powers Ahead| Cement In Focus| Closing Bell
items.description: Consolidaton after 6-day upmove .Benchmarks hold gains, broader markets slip .Nifty hits 23,800 level intra-day .Mid & smallcap indices down 1% . Most sectors in red; IT defies the trend .Nifty Bank cools off after reclaiming 52,000. Metals, PSU banks, Pharma & realty lose over a percent. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Punjab & Sind Bank shares rally 6% after lender launches QIP at floor price of Rs 40.38/share
items.description: Punjab & Sind Bank shares have now extended gains for the fifth consecutive session, rising over 16 percent during the period.

items.title: Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 23,700 as PSU banks, metal dampen mood; IT lone bright spot
items.description: The broader market also showcased weak trends, with the Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 slipping 1.1 and 1.5 percent, respectively.

items.title: CLSA sees 50% upside potential in Bandhan Bank shares, maintains 'high conviction outperform'
items.description: CLSA sees Bandhan as a key beneficiary of the MFI recovery cycle, supported by its shift toward secured loans.

items.title: Small, midcap indices down up to 2%, snap six day-rally as gains fizzles amid tariff overhang
items.description: The broader market indices underperformed benchmark index Nifty, which too was off highs as investors assessed the durability of the rally and tariff-related news flow.

items.title: Seamac Ltd stock rises up to 13%, highest in over a year
items.description: The company, in consortium with Posh India Offshore, secured a Letter of Award (LoA) from Larsen & Toubro for subsea installation work on the pipeline replacement project

items.title: IndusInd Bank shares down 5% on selling pressure after Rs 30 crore penalty over ‘various GST issues’
items.description: IndusInd Bank said the penalty imposed by Thane's Joint Commissioner of CGST & Central Excise pertains to 'various GST issues', and added that it may file an appeal against the said order.

items.title: Brigade Enterprises announces Rs 950-crore premium residential project; stock slips
items.description: The real estate developer has acquired a 4.4-acre land parcel, planning to develop 0.6 million square feet of premium residential space in one of Bengaluru’s most sought-after locations.

items.title: Easy Trip shares under pressure amid global expansion, aviation investment
items.description: Easy Trip Planners (EaseMyTrip) is expanding globally with new subsidiaries in Brazil and Saudi Arabia and a strategic investment in the U.S. to tap into high-growth travel markets. The company has also strengthened its Middle Eastern presence through new ventures in Dubai, focusing on tour operations and vacation rentals.

items.title: Markets trim gains: Sensex falls 650 pts from day's high, Nifty below 23,700 as PSU bank, pharma stocks drag
items.description: India VIX, a barometer to assess market anxiety, flared up 3 percent to hover just over the 14 level mark.

items.title: Graphite India, HEG shares rise up to 12% on Japan's 95% duty on Chinese electrodes
items.description: Japan's decision came after a probe concluded that China was harming local companies by exporting graphite electrodes at unfairly low prices, and also by flooding the market with supplies.
